item.description:
Our friends at GreenFleece Farm are hosting an open house (Saturday morning) & workshop (Saturday and Sunday) on natural building, straw bale and earthen plaster construction on Sat 8/27 & Sun 8/28 and members of the permaculture community are invited to join!

Details from GreenFleece:

 

---------------- 
Saturday AM Open House:

At 8:30 on Sat morning Bryan Felice will present an excellentslideshow presentation overview of natural construction techniques.He has some exciting “hot off the press” research on buildingperformance from DevaRacusin, who has been involved in constructing these systems foralmost 2 decades.


We will then give a brief overview of the design process for theaddition at GF Farm as well as the basics of passive solar design. At that time we will describe other workshops & opportunities that we hope to offer for observation or participation this fall: Cob Construction, Radiant Heat floor installation, Solar Hot Water design, Rocket Stove design, etc.

Workshop:

Sat afternoon will focus on the basics of straw bale insulation. Sunday will focus on earth plaster – recipes, techniques, tips for cold climates. We will have Bryan Felice on Sat & both Bryan & Deva Racusin providing instruction on Sunday.


Since it is an enormous amount to cover, Bryan, Deva & crew will beavailable on-site the following week for anyone interested in spending a day or half a day doing hands-on work under supervision. That week will focus on the fine detailing with straw & plaster. This is quite an opportunity to work with some very experienced folks in the field.


To register for workshops you can RSVP here but you must also contact Deb Ganster at GreenFleece (djganster@yahoo.com) to confirm and arrange payment, etc. There is a $45 charge for the weekend workshop participation (Saturday afternoon & Sunday). To attend as “open house” participant Sat morning & observe the process, registration is not necessary. For directions, contact Deb. To add work supervision the following week, contact Deb also. Questions for Bryan: bryan@undustrial.org.
